headline: Trump Outlines Plan to Unwind Biden-Era Car Mileage Mandates
summary: “Today my administration is taking historic action to lower costs for American consumers, protect American auto jobs and make buying a car much more affordable for countless American families — and also safer,” Trump said in an Oval Office event Wednesday with representatives from Detroit’s major automakers.  Trump was joined by Stellantis NV Chief Executive Officer Antonio Filosa, Ford Motor Co. CEO Jim Farley and John Urbanic, plant manager at General Motors Co.’s Orion Assembly plant outside Detroit.

raw.headline: Trump Outlines Plan to Unwind Biden-Era Car Mileage Mandates
raw.summary: “Today my administration is taking historic action to lower costs for American consumers, protect American auto jobs and make buying a car much more affordable for countless American families — and also safer,” Trump said in an Oval Office event Wednesday with representatives from Detroit’s major automakers.  Trump was joined by Stellantis NV Chief Executive Officer Antonio Filosa, Ford Motor Co. CEO Jim Farley and John Urbanic, plant manager at General Motors Co.’s Orion Assembly plant outside Detroit.

headline: Ford, GM, Stellantis Stocks Rise. Thank President Trump.
summary: Shares of traditional auto makers rose on Wednesday, boosted by proposed policy changes that favor gasoline-powered cars over their all-electric peers.  Shares of Chrysler’s parent,  Stellantis  rose 4.5% to $11.46.  President Donald Trump spoke in the Oval Office, saying he has instructed Transportation Secretary Sean Duffy to rescind the “horrible CAFE standards,” which govern how efficient cars must be.

headline: Trump rolls back Biden-era fuel economy standards, paving way for more gas-powered cars
summary: President Trump rolled back fuel economy rules that he claimed created an “EV mandate” after former President Joe Biden imposed stricter fuel economy standards last year.

summary: Watch the Video Lee opened the conversation by pointing to the timing of the cargo-plane crisis. headline: Ford’s EV Plans Ruined
summary: Ford’s electric vehicle sales were down sharply in November. Despite its huge investment in EVs, the company will focus on gasoline-powered vehicles for now.

headline: Rivian Is Recalling 35,000 EVs. Investors Are Fine With That.
summary: Take  Rivian  Its shares were down 0.2% at $17.20 in premarket trading, while  and  futures were 0.2% and 0.3% lower, respectively.  Investors might have expected the stock to slide because the National Highway Traffic Safety Administration, or NHTSA, recently posted a recall notice.  Rivian will fix the issue with an over-the-air software update and inspect the parts free of charge.

headline: Amazon Expands Its Used Car Blitz As Auto Loan Rates Drop
summary: Used-car wholesale prices declined slightly compared with a year ago in the first half of November and, as new and used car loan rates fall, sales are expected to pick up moving toward the end of the year.  Ford is the second auto company to offer models on the platform.

headline: What's Behind Ford's EV Sales Plunge of 60% in November?
summary: F's EV sales plunge more than 60% in November after a key tax credit expired, even as hybrids rise and the company pivots to smaller future models.

headline: Ford (F) Valuation Check After Standout Quarter of Revenue Growth and Earnings Beats
summary: Ford Motor (F) just delivered a quarter that caught Wall Street’s attention, with revenue jumping around 9% year over year and earnings comfortably ahead of expectations, helping push the stock higher since the release. See our latest analysis for Ford Motor. The strong quarter has come on top of an already solid run, with Ford’s share price returning 34.3% year to date and its 1 year total shareholder return of 28.7% suggesting momentum is building as investors reassess earnings resilience,...

headline: EVgo Autocharge+ Surpasses 5 Million Sessions and Sixfold Enrollment Growth, Delivering Seamless EV Charging Nationwide

headline: Should Ford’s Big Earnings Beat Despite EV Slump Require Action From Ford Motor (F) Investors?
summary: Ford Motor recently reported quarterly revenue of US$50.53 billion, up 9.4% year on year and ahead of analyst forecasts, delivering earnings and EBITDA that surpassed expectations and marked the strongest analyst beat among major automakers. This outperformance came despite softer U.S. sales, aluminum supply disruptions and a steep 61% decline in EV volumes, underscoring the current importance of Ford’s higher-margin, non-EV operations and hybrids to its overall results. With this earnings...
